DataElement.preferredName: Adverse Event First Awareness Occurrence Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Calendar date on which a person is first informed or gains knowledge that a patient has experienced an adverse event.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding) temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s)._Preceding all others in time or space or degree._Knowing that something exists, or having knowledge or experience of a particular thing; having special interest in or experience of something and so being well informed of what is happening in that subject at the present time._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Property.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:Knowing that something exists, or having knowledge or experience of a particular thing; having special interest in or experience of something and so being well informed of what is happening in that subject at the present time.:An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.

Knowing that something exists, or having knowledge or experience of a particular thing; having special interest in or experience of something and so being well informed of what is happening in that subject at the present time.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created to support caAERS integration with Rave

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.  [Explanatory comment: The preferred exchange format for the Date datatype is YYYYMMDD. YYYY is a year of the Gregorian Calendar and may contain the integers 1 or 2 in the first position and the integers 0 to 9 in the remaining three positions. MM is a month; the months of the Gregorian Calendar should be represented by the values 00 to 12 beginning with January as 01. DD is a day and may be represented by the values 00 to 31. A Full Date would contain all three elements in the format YYYYMMDD. Partial Dates may be expressed by using the data elements for Year, Month, or Day.  The display format for Date information is determined by programmatic requirements.]

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/18/2010 Add DICOM Date as alternate name and definition.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support NCI caAERS integration with Rave 6.2014 D.Reeves
